0.name: Data Structure
0.description: Perform the construction of a specialized data organization and storage for their ease of access.

1.name: Discrete Structure
1.description: Passively increases the study of discrete mathematical structures in computer science.

2.name: Algorithms
2.description: Enables the construction of computation sequence used to solve a class of specific problems. Passively increases the complexity and depth of code sequences.

3.name: Computer Systems
3.description: Learns the construction of the computer's operating system/hardware and software. Passively increases the study of computing capabilities.

4.name: Performance
4.description: Imbues the mind with desire to construct computer systems and applications with efficiency and speed. Passively increases resource utilization.

5.name: Design Patterns
5.description: Imbues the code with patterns or templates that can be reused when designing an application or system.

6.name: Efficiency
6.description: Imbues the code with the best solution such that it would run efficiently. Passively increases the structure of the code.

7.name: Higher-Order Programming
7.description: Applies a programming style that utilizes software components as higher-order functions—a function that takes one or more functions as arguments, or returns a function as its result.

8.name: Cleanliness
8.description: Learns the quality of code readability and maintainability. Passively compresses the code structures.

9.name: Optimization
9.description: Applies a modifying process to a system such that it would would use fewer resources, executes more rapidly, operates with less memory storage, or draws less power.

10.name: Frameworks & Integrations
10.description: Imbues the code with structures and libraries made by others to speed up development processes. Allows the construction of these applications and solutions.

11.name: Dynamic Programming
11.description: Enhances the code system with an optimization method to problems that can be solved in a recursive manner. Passively increases code efficiency.

12.name: Asynchronous Programming
12.description: Applies a programming technique that enables the system to still be responsive to other events while performing another task.

13.name: Maintainability
13.description: Passively increases code readability and consistency.

14.name: Profiling
14.description: Measures the space or time complexity of particular instructions, or the frequency and duration of function calls.

15.name: Debugging
15.description: Passively increases insight to find defects or problems that prevent correct operations, i.e. bugs, within systems.

16.name: Responsiveness
16.description: Passively increases code adaptability in different environments; bonus doubles in a web development.

17.name: Software Architecture
17.description: Learns the discipline of constructing structures necessary for a software system. Increases maximum study power, and reduces global cooldown for study and engineering skills.

18.name: Automation
18.description: Imbues the system with scripts or a batch processings to save time, reduce effort, and perform complex and tedious operations. Increases code speed and reduces potential bugs.

19.name: Modular Programming
19.description: Applies a software design technique emphasizing on the separation of a program's functionality. Targets are broken down into interchangable and independent modules that contains necessary tools to execute only one aspect of the desired functionality.

20.name: Version Control
20.description: Applies documented changes and numbers to computer programs and software code. Allows code to be replaced with its previous versions.

21.name: Monitoring
21.description: Learns the observation and data collection from systems or networks. Passively increases code's proper functioning, performance, and security.

22.name: Scalability
22.description: Increases the system's ability to increase in performance and decrease in cost relative to the changes in its processing demands.

23.name: Networking
23.description: Write programs or processes that can communicate with one another across a network to relay and receive information.

24.name: Cloud Computing
24.description: Learns the construction of an on-demand access to computing resources hosted at a remote data center managed by a cloud services provider.

25.name: Systems Design
25.description: Passively increases knowledge in architecture, components, modules, interfaces, and data development.

26.name: Scripting
26.description: Learns the construction of instructions that automates various step-by-step processes to a computer as with all forms of programming.

27.name: Software Testing
27.description: Examine the artifacts and the behavior of the software under test by validation and verification. Decreases chance of receiving bugs.

28.name: Software Analysis
28.description: Gain insights of behavior, performance, and structure from the system by code, data, and algorithms examinations. Passively increases maximum study power.

29.name: Data Handling
29.description: Learns the ability to record and collect data which is presented into valuable insights or actionable information. Passively increases mind regeneration.

30.name: Software Security
30.description: Passively increases software level of protection through security mechanisms.

31.name: Software Engineering
31.description: Designs, develops, tests, maintains, and evaluates computer software through an engineering-based approach.

32.name: Distributed Computing
32.description: Develops a system whose components are located on different networked computers, which communicate and coordinate their actions by passing messages to one another.

33.name: Usability
33.description: Allows the code to be reused by others. Passively increases code effectiveness and efficiency.

34.name: CI/CD
34.description: Learns the discipline of continuous integration (frequent merging of several small changes into a main branch) and continuous delivery (the rapid and reliable software release).

35.name: Big Data
35.description: Unlocks the ability to organize and administer large volumes of both structured and unstructured data.

36.name: Ethical Hacking
36.description: Identify any vulnerabilities or security issues the current system has with the aim to improve upon its security. Passively increases code security.

37.name: Computer Graphics
37.description: Learns the sub-field of computer science which studies methods for digitally synthesizing and manipulating visual content.

38.name: Cryptography
38.description: Applies a programming technique for a secure communication in the presence of an adversarial behavior. Increases maximum code security.

39.name: Research
39.description: Study and investigate materials, sources, papers, etc, in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.

40.name: Artificial Intelligence
40.description: Delves into a computer science field that develops and studies intelligent machines.

41.name: Game Design
41.description: Develops video games by the creation of the mechanics, systems, and its rules. Passively increases max flair.

42.name: Computer Vision
42.description: Learns the methods for acquiring, processing, analyzing, and understanding digital images along with the extraction of high-dimensional data from the real world in order to produce numerical or symbolic information.

43.name: Data Science
43.description: Learns an interdisciplinary academic field that uses statistics, scientific computing and methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract or extrapolate knowledge and insights from potentially noisy, structured, or unstructured data.

44.name: Deep Learning
44.description: Applies an artificial neural networks with representation learning to the system.

45.name: Simulation
45.description: Passively increases the study of modeling a real phenomenon with a set of mathematical formulas. Increases maximum levels of study, theory, knowledge, and application skills.

46.name: VR/AR
46.description: Constructs computer modeling and simulation that enables a person to interact with an artificial three-dimensional visual or other sensory environment.

47.name: Advanced Topics
47.description: Increases the study level of subjects or themes that are characterized by a higher level of complexity, depth, and specialization.

48.name: HTML
48.description: The standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser; it defines the content and structure of web content.

49.name: php
49.description: A popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to web development.

50.name: Javascript
50.description: A high-level programming language often just-in-time compiled language that conforms to the ECMAScript standard.

51.name: Python
51.description: A high-level, general-purpose, dynamically typed, and garbage-collected programming language that supports multiple programming paradigms, including structured object-oriented and functional programming.

52.name: Laravel
52.description: A free and open-source PHP web framework intended for the development of web applications following the model-view-controller (MVC) architectural pattern, based on Symfony.

53.name: CSS
53.description: A style sheet language used for specifying the presentation and styling of a document written in a markup language such as HTML or XML.

54.name: JQuery
54.description: A JavaScript library designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling, CSS animations, and Ajax.

55.name: Ruby
55.description: A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.

56.name: Flask
56.description: A micro web framework written in Python that does not require particular tools or libraries.

57.name: Sass/SCSS
57.description: A preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into Cascading Style Sheets (CSS); SCSS is a newer syntax of the Sass preprocessor scripting language.

58.name: Node.js
58.description: A cross-platform, open-source JavaScript runtime environment that can run on Windows, Linux, Unix, macOS, and more.

59.name: Java
59.description: A high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

60.name: MySQL
60.description: An open-source relational database management system (RDBMS).

61.name: React
61.description: A free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on components.

62.name: Vue.js
62.description: An open-source model-view-viewmodel front end JavaScript library for building user interfaces and single-page applications.

63.name: Angular 2+
63.description: A TypeScript-based, free and open-source single-page web application framework.

64.name: Spring (Boot)
64.description: An application framework and inversion of control container for the Java platform; Spring Boot Extension is Spring's convention-over-configuration solution intended to aid in creating production-grade Spring applications with minimal amounts of configuration.

65.name: Git
65.description: A distributed version control system that tracks changes in any set of computer files, usually used for coordinating work among programmers who are collaboratively developing source code during software development.

66.name: Firebase
66.description: A set of backend cloud computing services and application development platforms provided by Google.

67.name: Next.JS
67.description: An open-source web development framework created by the private company Vercel providing React-based web applications with server-side rendering and static website generation.

68.name: Typescript
68.description: A free and open-source high-level programming language developed by Microsoft that adds static typing with optional type annotations to JavaScript.

69.name: PostgreSQL
69.description: A free and open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) emphasizing extensibility and SQL compliance that feature transactions with atomicity, consistency, isolation, durability (ACID) properties, automatically updatable views, materialized views, triggers, foreign keys, and stored procedures.

70.name: Django
70.description: A high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

71.name: Go
71.description: A statically typed, compiled high-level programming language that has memory safety, garbage collection, structural typing, and CSP-style concurrency.

72.name: Gitlab
72.description: An open source end-to-end software development platform with built-in version control, issue tracking, code review, CI/CD, and more.

73.name: Github
73.description: A developer platform that allows developers to create, store, manage and share their code; it uses Git software, providing the distributed version control of Git plus access control, bug tracking, software feature requests, task management, continuous integration, and wikis for every project.

74.name: Jest
74.description: A JavaScript testing framework designed to ensure correctness of any JavaScript codebase that allows you to write tests with an approachable, familiar and feature-rich API, giving results quickly.

75.name: GraphQL
75.description: an open-source data query and manipulation language for APIs and a query runtime engine that enables declarative data fetching where a client can specify exactly what data it needs from an API.

76.name: MongoDB
76.description: A source-available, cross-platform, document-oriented database program, classified as a NoSQL database product that utilizes JSON-like documents with optional schemas.

77.name: Docker
77.description: A set of platform as a service (PaaS) products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

78.name: Google Cloud Platform
78.description: A suite of cloud computing services, offered by Google, that provides a series of modular cloud services including computing, data storage, data analytics, and machine learning, alongside a set of management tools.

79.name: AWS
79.description: A suite of cloud computing services, offered by Amazon, that provides on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs to individuals, companies, and governments, on a metered, pay-as-you-go basis.

80.name: C
80.description: a procedural, general-purpose, highly flexible, and powerful computer programming language used to develop operating systems, databases, applications, etc; considered as the mother language of all modern programming languages.

81.name: Ansible
81.description: An open source, command-line IT automation software application written in Python. It can configure systems, deploy software, and orchestrate advanced workflows to support application deployment, system updates, and more.

82.name: Jenkins
82.description: A self-contained, open source automation server which can be used to automate all sorts of tasks related to building, testing, and delivering or deploying software.

83.name: Datadog
83.description: An observability service for cloud-scale applications, providing monitoring of servers, databases, tools, and services, through a SaaS-based data analytics platform; the mascot is a dog named Bits.

84.name: C#
84.description: A general-purpose high-level programming language that can be used to create a number of different programs and applications: mobile apps, desktop apps, cloud-based services, websites, enterprise software and games.

85.name: C++
85.description: A high-level, general-purpose programming language that has object-oriented, generic, and functional features, in addition to facilities for low-level memory manipulation.

86.name: PyTorch
86.description: A machine learning framework based on the Torch library, used for applications such as computer vision and natural language processing.

87.name: Kubernetes
87.description: An open-source container orchestration system for automating software deployment, scaling, and management.

88.name: ASP.NET Core
88.description: An open-source modular web-application framework: a redesign of ASP.NET that unites the previously separate ASP.NET MVC and ASP.NET Web API into a single programming model.

89.name: Unity
89.description: A cross-platform game engine used to create three-dimensional (3D) and two-dimensional (2D) games, as well as interactive simulations and other experiences.

90.name: TensorFlow
90.description: A free and open-source software library for machine learning and artificial intelligence.

91.name: Rust
91.description: A multi-paradigm, general-purpose programming language that emphasizes performance, type safety, and concurrency.

92.name: Symfony
92.description: A free and open-source PHP web application framework and a set of reusable PHP component libraries.

93.name: TailwindCSS
93.description: An open source CSS framework containing a list of utility CSS classes that can be used to style each element by mixing and matching.

94.name: OCaml
94.description: A general-purpose, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language which extends the Caml dialect of ML with object-oriented features.

95.name: Shapes
95.description: Understands the concept of artwork created through lines or by other shapes such as triangles, circles, and squares.

96.name: Notation
96.description: Understands the system of graphics, symbols, or characters used to represent words, sounds, pitches, or other elements in a standardized and communicable form.

97.name: Perspective
97.description: Imbues the artwork with an impression of space, depth and scale.

98.name: Structure
98.description: Understands the underlying framework that gives form and coherence to the artwork. Passively increases the quality of the artwork.

99.name: Color
99.description: Imbues the artwork with hues and tints, or richness, textures, and tonal qualities to convey emotion and mood.

100.name: Tone
100.description: Imbues the artwork with character of color, duration, pitch, or intensity, and timbre. Passively increases the artwork's dynamics.

101.name: Tempo
101.description: Understands the utilization of different speed or pace of a given composition. Passively increases theory power.

102.name: Proportion
102.description: Enhances the artwork with height, width, and depth. Passively increases artwork's dynamics.

103.name: Texture
103.description: Ehnances the artwork with surface quality or different layers to produce the overall illusion. Passively increases the quality of artwork.

104.name: Harmony
104.description: Understands the combination of colours, shapes, and other elements to create a pleasing or balanced effect. Passively increases theory power.

105.name: Dynamics
105.description: Enhances the artwork with movement, energy, or loudness. Passively increases artwork's thrill level and decreases predictability.

106.name: Rhythm
106.description: Understands the timing of musical sounds and silences that occur over time, or the steps of a dance, or the meter of spoken language and poetry.

107.name: Observation
107.description: Unlocks the ability to learn by looking at a subject and making a representation through an art medium. Passively increases artwork's quality and maximum flair.

108.name: Expression
108.description: Unlocks the ability to craft an idea, feeling, and emotion to life through the use of basic art techniques. Passively increases artwork's quality and maximum flair.

109.name: Composition
109.description: Unlocks the ability to combine and arrange different elements of an artwork to convey specific stories or meaning within an image. Passively increases artwork's quality and maximum flair.

110.name: Intention
110.description: Unlocks the ability to integrate a purpose or motivation to an artwork. Passively increases artwork's quality and maximum flair.

111.name: Articulation
111.description: Unlocks the ability to structure an artwork's clarity, precision, and effectiveness by determining the length of its sound and the shape of its attack and decay. Passively increases artwork's quality and maximum flair.

112.name: Motion
112.description: Enhances the artwork with movement and action.

113.name: Material
113.description: Allows the enhancement of substance or mixture to an artwork. Passively increases the artwork's dynamics.

114.name: Anatomy
114.description: Understands the structure of organisms and their parts as a reference for the artwork. Passively increases maximum flair.

115.name: Narrative
115.description: Crafts a series of related events or experiences through a sequence of written or spoken words, movements, or music.

116.name: Voice
116.description: Passively increases performing arts level related to sounds.

117.name: Phrasing
117.description: Enhances the artwork with shapes a sequence of notes or words in a passage to allow expression. Passively increases artwork's expression levels.

118.name: Sight-Reading
118.description: Performs a piece of music live while reading the script. Passively increases theory power.

119.name: Shading
119.description: Understands the technique of darknening and lighting to create the illusion of depth. Passively increases artwork's quality.

120.name: Lighting
120.description: Illuminate a subject or scene to enhancing the aesthetic qualities, mood, and storytelling aspects of the artwork.

121.name: Genre
121.description: Passively increases the theory power level through a category of literature, music, or other forms of art.

122.name: Gesture
122.description: Enhances the artwork with intentional movement, physical or expression, to evoke meaning, emotion, or narrative.

123.name: Modelling
123.description: Crafts a three-dimensional representations of objects, figures, or scenes using various materials and techniques.

124.name: Photography
124.description: Crafts images by recording light, either electronically by means of an image sensor, or chemically by means of a light-sensitive material such as photographic film.

125.name: Storyboarding
125.description: Organizes illustrations or images that are displayed in sequence to pre-visualize a motion picture, animation, motion graphic or interactive media sequence.

126.name: Dialogue
126.description: Communicates and expresses emotions and personalities in an artwork through words. Passively increases max flair.

127.name: Performance
127.description: Executes a artwork in front of a live audience. Passively increases skills related to theatre, music, and dance.

128.name: Sculpting
128.description: Crafts a three-dimensional artwork presented in the dimensions of height, width and depth through carving an object.

129.name: Editing
129.description: Selects and prepares written, visual, audible, or cinematic material to convey a message or information.

130.name: Animation
130.description: Crafts moving images with still images which are drawn or painted by hand.

131.name: Characterization
131.description: Understands the representation of persons, creatures, or other beings in narrative and dramatic works. Passively increases max flair, theory power, and artwork's quality.

132.name: Technique
132.description: Passively increases max flair, theory power, artwork's quality, all art skills, and decreases all art skills' global cooldown.

133.name: Rendering
133.description: Generates a photorealistic or non-photorealistic image from a 2D or 3D model through a computer program.

134.name: Visual Effects
134.description: Crafts the illusion of visual imagery in filmmaking and video production.

135.name: Stagecraft
135.description: Passively enhances the technical aspect of theatrical, film, and video production. Increases maximum flair and art skills levels: construction and rigs, lighting, costume designs, make-up, stage management, and audio engineering.

136.name: Musicality
136.description: Significantly increases the sensitivity for music.

137.name: Concept Art
137.description: Crafts an idea for use in films, video games, animation, comic books, television shows, or other media before it is put into the final product.

138.name: Industrial Design
138.description: Crafts physical products to be manufactured by mass production.

139.name: Cinematography
139.description: Crafts the art of motion picture photography.

140.name: Choreography
140.description: Enhances the artwork by designing sequences of movements of physical bodies.

141.name: Acting
141.description: Enhances the artwork through an enactment of a character. Passively increases max flair and artwork's quality.

142.name: Scriptwriting
142.description: Crafts scripts for mass media such as feature films, television productions or video games.

143.name: Orchestration
143.description: Crafts music for an orchestra or musical ensemble.

144.name: Virtuoso
144.description: Transforms into an individual possessing outstanding talent and technical ability in a music. Flair and focus will stop regenerating while transformed, but the level of artwork quality increases to maximum (gradually decreasing over time).

145.name: Linework
145.description: Enhances the artwork with the use of lines to delineate forms, shapes, and contours within a visual composition.

146.name: Typography
146.description: Crafts stylistic written language to be more appealing when displayed.

147.name: Graphic Design
147.description: Crafts text and graphics using manual or digital tools to visually communicate an idea and expression.

148.name: Ear-training
148.description: Passively enhances theory power, aural skills, and hearing capabilities.

149.name: Repertoire
149.description: Passively enhances theory power through a set of dramas, operas, musical compositions or roles.

150.name: Conducting
150.description: Directs an orchestral or choral concert. Passively increases flair regeneration.

151.name: Pencil
151.description: A writing or drawing implement with a solid pigment core in a protective casing that reduces the risk of core breakage, and keeps it from marking the user's hand.

152.name: Pen
152.description: A common drawing and writing instrument that applies ink to a surface.

153.name: Sing
153.description: The act of creating musical sounds with the voice.

154.name: Brush
154.description: A common tool with bristles, wire or other filaments used to apply paint or ink.

155.name: Audacity
155.description: A free and open-source digital audio editor and recording application software for beginners.

156.name: Krita
156.description: A free and open-source raster graphics editor designed primarily for digital art and 2D animation.

157.name: ZBrush
157.description: A digital sculpting tool that combines 3D/2.5D modeling, texturing and painting.

158.name: Adobe Photoshop
158.description: A raster graphics editor for professional digital art, especially in raster graphics editing.

159.name: Adobe Audition
159.description: A digital audio workstation developed by Adobe Inc. featuring both a multitrack, non-destructive mix/edit environment and a destructive-approach waveform editing view.

160.name: GarageBand
160.description: A digital audio workstation (DAW) and music sequencer that can record and play back multiple tracks of audio.

161.name: Adobe Illustrator
161.description: A vector graphics editor and design program.

162.name: 3ds Max
162.description: A professional 3D computer graphics program for making 3D animations, models, games and images.

163.name: Blender
163.description: A free and open-source 3D computer graphics software tool set used for creating animated films, visual effects, art, 3D-printed models, motion graphics, interactive 3D applications, virtual reality, and, formerly, video games.

164.name: Adobe Premiere Pro
164.description: A timeline-based and non-linear video editing software application (NLE).

165.name: FL Studio
165.description: A digital audio workstation that can be used as either a Virtual Studio Technology (VST) or Audio Unit (AU) instrument in other audio workstation programs, and as a ReWire client.

166.name: MuseScore
166.description: A music notation program for Windows, macOS, and Linux supporting a wide variety of file formats and input methods.

168.name: Autodesk Maya
168.description: A 3D computer graphics application used to create assets for interactive 3D applications (including video games), animated films, TV series, and visual effects.

169.name: Houdini
169.description: A 3D animation software application used to produce different effects such as complex reflections, animations and particles system.

170.name: ADobe After Effects
170.description: A digital visual effects, motion graphics, and compositing application used in the post-production process of film making, video games and television production.

171.name: Adobe Lightroom
171.description: A piece of image organization and image processing software.

172.name: Brasses Specialization
172.description: A musical instrument that produces sound by sympathetic vibration of air in a tubular resonator in sympathy with the vibration of the player's lips; brass, trombone, trumpet, tuba, or french horn.

173.name: Ableton Live
173.description: A digital audio workstation designed to be an instrument for live performances as well as a tool for composing, recording, arranging, mixing, and mastering.

174.name: Blackmagic Fusion
174.description: A post-production image compositing used to create visual effects and digital compositing for movies, TV-series, and commercials.

175.name: Cinema 4D
175.description: A professional 3D modeling, animation, simulation and rendering software solution.

176.name: Foundry Katana
176.description: Fast and formidable, Katana is a look development and lighting powerhouse that tackles creative challenges with ferocity and ease.

177.name: Rhino
177.description: A commercial 3D computer graphics and computer-aided design (CAD) application software based on the NURBS mathematical model, which focuses on producing mathematically precise representation of curves and freeform surfaces in computer graphics.

178.name: Unity
178.description: A cross-platform game engine used to create three-dimensional (3D) and two-dimensional (2D) games, as well as interactive simulations and other experiences.

179.name: Foundry Nuke
179.description: A node-based digital compositing and visual effects application.

180.name: DaVinci Resolve
180.description: A color grading, color correction, visual effects, and audio post-production video editing application.

181.name: Keyboards Specialization
181.description: A musical instrument played using a keyboard, a row of levers that are pressed by the fingers: keyboards, piano, harpsichord, or pipe organ.

182.name: Steinberg Cubase
182.description: An industry standard digital audio workstation for recording, arranging, and editing that is used by world-class composers.

183.name: Adobe Substance Painter
183.description: A 3D painting software that allows users to texture and add materials directly to 3D meshes in real-time.

184.name: Unreal Engine
184.description: A series of 3D computer graphics game engines used in a variety of industries, most notably the film and television industry.

185.name: Foundry Modo
185.description: A powerful and flexible 3D modeling, animation, texturing and rendering toolset empowers artists to explore and develop ideas without jumping through technical hoops.

186.name: Woodwinds Specialization
186.description: A musical instrument that contains resonator in which a column of air is set into vibration by the player blowing into (or over) a mouthpiece set at or near the end of the resonator; flute, clarinet, oboe, or bassoon.

187.name: Avid Pro Tools
187.description: A digital audio workstation used for music creation and production, sound for picture and, more generally, sound recording, editing, and mastering processes.

188.name: Autodesk Fusion 360
188.description: A commercial computer-aided design (CAD), computer-aided manufacturing (CAM), computer-aided engineering (CAE) and printed circuit board (PCB) design software application.

189.name: Avid Media Composer
189.description: A video editing application or non-linear editing system, allowing offline and online editing workflows up to 16K editing and finishing.

190.name: Strings Specialization
190.description: A musical instrument that produce sound from vibrating strings when a performer plays or sounds the strings in some manner: guitar, viola, double bass, cello, harp, violin.

191.name: Clip Studio Paint
191.description: A family of software applications used for the digital creation of comics, general illustration, and 2D animation.

192.name: Autodesk Alias
192.description: A family of computer-aided industrial design software predominantly used in automotive design and industrial design for generating class A surfaces using Bézier surface and non-uniform rational B-spline modeling method.

193.name: Foundry Mari
193.description: A 3D texture painting software used for creating highly detailed textures and materials for 3D models.

194.name: Sibelius
194.description: A scorewriter program used to write, edit, refine, hear, scan, and print music scores.

195.name: Dorico Pro
195.description: A scorewriter software that has advanced scoring capabilities, flexible input methods, and comprehensive notation options.

196.name: Percussions Specialization
196.description: A musical instrument that is sounded by being struck or scraped by a beater including attached or enclosed beaters or rattles struck, scraped or rubbed by hand or struck against another similar instrument: timpani, snare drum, marimba, xylophone, orchestral bass drum, or cymbals.

197.name: Finale
197.description: A scorewriter tool that offers a high level of control for its versatility and robust feature set.

198.name: Toon Boom - Harmony
198.description: The worldwide standard for 2D animation productions.

199.name: Interest
199.description: Allows one to take part in physical and/or recreational activities.

200.name: Strength
200.description: Physical prowess to apply a force and/or overcome a resistance.

201.name: Agility
201.description: Allows the body to move about quickly and easily through obstacles.

202.name: Intelligence
202.description: Unlocks the ability to learn and understand topics about sports and games. Passively increases knowledge.

203.name: Endurance
203.description: Passively increases stamina to do work or effort over a long period of time.

204.name: Dexterity
204.description: Allows the body to perform difficult actions quickly and skilfully.

205.name: Concentration
205.description: Enables the mind to spend focus and attention to improve the action's quality. Passively increases focus regeneration.

206.name: Resilience
206.description: Physical and mental prowess to withstand difficulties. Passively increases physical and mental defences.

207.name: Coordination
207.description: Allows the body to perform a difficult maneuvers with ease and grace.

208.name: Speed
208.description: Rapidly perform a task within a short amount of time. Passively increases action speed and decreases global cooldown.

209.name: Communication
209.description: Relays information effectively and efficiently to other team members. Passively increases teamwork.

211.name: Composure
211.description: Unlocks the methods of calmness and confidence. Passively increases focus regeneration and control.

212.name: Memorization
212.description: Learns information and commits them into memory banks. Increases knowledge power.

213.name: Discipline
213.description: Allows the body to perform consistency of following rules. Passively enhances physical and mental strength.

214.name: Precision
214.description: Executes a task with accuracy. Passively increases accuracy.

215.name: Reflex
215.description: Enhances the body with reaction speed to an external stimulus. Passively increases speed.

216.name: Intuition
216.description: Enhances the body with capability to tackle problem instinctively. Passively increases knowledge power and instinct.

217.name: Decision-Making
217.description: Determines a more valuable choice between two or more options. Passively increases max focus.

218.name: Multitasking
218.description: Handles multiple tasks simultaneously. Passively increases maximum knowledge power and focus.

219.name: Technique
219.description: Significantly increases the knowledge power and focus regeneration.

220.name: Consistency
220.description: Enhances the body with capability to perform quality work in a repeated way. Passively increases teamwork.

221.name: Versatility
221.description: Performs well with a range of physical prowess. Passively increases focus regeneration and knowledge power.

222.name: Game Sense
222.description: Enhances the body with capability to understand a sport or competitive video game at a strategic level.

223.name: Adaptability
223.description: Adjusts the body to the different environments.

224.name: Ingenuity
224.description: Enhance sthe mind to produce original and unusual ideas. Passively increases maximum mana, flair, and focus, mana regeneration, and greatly decreases flair costs.

225.name: Execution
225.description: Performs a task with accuracy and speed as determined by the listed requirements or sequences.

226.name: Utility
226.description: Plays several flexible roles competently that acts as a support or bridge between the forward and the back.

227.name: Leadership
227.description: Leads the team to achieve a specific goal through guidance and direction.

228.name: Tactics
228.description: Forms strategy and planning from knowledge and experience to tackle problems or counter the opposing team's strategies.

229.name: Positioning
229.description: Learns the ability to find the best path and location amongst the battlefield to gain an positional advantage. Significantly increases vision.

230.name: Teamplayer
230.description: Significantly increases teamwork, knowledge power, technique and adaptability skill levels, and playstyle.

231.name: Analysing
231.description: Learns the ability to observe and study techniques and strategies in details and find solutions to them. Passively increases maximum mana.

232.name: Timing
232.description: Learns the ability to find the perfect moments in games to peform the sequence of tasks. Significantly increases speed, analysis, precision, decision-making, and intuition skill levels.

233.name: Finisher
233.description: Transforms into an individual who fulfils the goals from the resources and opportunity provided by the team. Significantly increases core mechanics.

234.name: Striking
234.description: Learns the ability to pressure the opposition and see the weakpoints within the defences. Significantly increases strength.

235.name: Supporting
235.description: Learns the ability to pave the pathway for the cores to execute. Significantly increases teamwork.

236.name: Scout
236.description: Transforms into an individual who scours and travels to gather informations or people around environments to gain strategical advantages. While transformed, gain increased vision, stamina, knowledge power, and communications.

237.name: Organizing
237.description: Learns the ability to arrange and schedule tasks with a better flow in a specified duration. Significantly increases mana, flair, and focus regeneration, and speed and discipline skill level.

238.name: Playmaker
238.description: Transforms into an individual who controls the pacing of the game and provides the opportunity for the team to fulfil the plan. While transformed, gain increased vision and focus regeneration.

239.name: Offence
239.description: Transforms into an individual who pressures and attacks the opposition's base or defences. While transformed, gain increased insight, concentration, stamina regneration, and speed.

240.name: Defence
240.description: Transforms into an individual who protects other teammates or the base from opponent's offences. While transformed, gain temporary increase in strength, balance, and speed.

241.name: Manager
241.description: Transforms into an individual who runs the team and is involved in various administrative aspect of the team. While transformed, gain increased communication, knowledge power, and analysis and tactics skill level.

242.name: Centre
242.description: Transforms into an individual who connects the front and the back while stabilizing the team's core tactics under game pressure. Passively increases vision, communication, composure, and consistency levels. While transformed, gain temporary bonus to strength, agility, and intelligence.

243.name: Competitor
243.description: Transforms into an individual who trains and participates in a solo or team-based competition. Significantly increases all knowledge skills. While transformed, decreases focus regeneration but greatly increases quality of work.

244.name: Coach
244.description: Transforms into an individual who trains the team members and instructs them with strategies. Passively increases knowledge power, flair regeneration, and communication, strategy, and analysis skill levels.
